PAGE.TITLE: Product Rule
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
The derivative of a product of functions, $f(x) = g(x)h(x)$, with respect to $x$ is given by the product rule:
$$
\frac{\textrm{d}f(x)}{\textrm{d}x} = h(x)\frac{\textrm{d}g(x)}{\textrm x} g(x)\frac{\textrm{d}h(x)}{\textrm{x}}
$$

UL.LI: You should be able to write out the product rule.
You should be able to use the product rule to calculate the derivative of products of functions.
You should be able to use the product rule in tandem with the chain rule to find derivatives for particularly complicated functions.
